title: Orrin Hatch: Stop Avoiding Town Halls!
text:
target: Orrin Hatch 
Constituents in Utah want Orrin Hatch to hold a town hall. Unsurprisingly, he is ignoring them. Utahns, despite generally leaning right, are increasingly concerned with the direction of the Trump presidency. Yet Orrin Hatch has continually acted as, at best, a Trump apologist, and at worst, a Trump cheerleader. Recently, Hatch said, "Give this president a chance. .... He's doing things, without any help from the other side, that just need to be done."The Utah legislature is being watched with a closer eye than ever, and recent Town Halls have been so packed that many residents haven't even been able to get a seat. GOP Representative Jason Chaffetz was met with harsh criticism from constituents just a few weeks ago. But rather than accept the critiques and address them, Chaffetz lied, saying that most of the people in attendance were "paid, out-of-state protestors." Like many of the claims coming from both the Trump Administration and GOP members of Congress, there is not a single piece of evidence to back this claim. The reality is that constituents are disgusted with the behavior of their local and national legislatures, and members of the Republican Party are terrified of this.Hatch is using this lie to avoid a Town Hall. But Utahns deserve accountability. Being a member of the majority party in the Senate does not make you exempt from your constituents. Being the GOP's longest serving Senator does not excuse ignoring criticism. Being the oldest Republican Senator does not give you the right to defend Donald Trump's bigotry. Sign now to demand: Orrin Hatch, agree to a town hall! read petition letter â–¾
